When you get there, the door is unlocked, and the entrance hall is lined with candles, as if someone was using them only a moment ago. Yet, the room and floor is covered in dust. It's obvious that no one has entered this place in years, if not decades, because the layer of dust is so thick that just a step clouds up the air in front of you enough to obscure your sight.
